sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set constructed by recursively removing the middle third of intervals from the closed interval $[0,1]$?
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set can be computed using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension = $\frac{\log N}{\log (1/s)}$

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and s is the scaling factor.

In the case of the Cantor set constructed by recursively removing the middle third of intervals from the closed interval $[0,1]$, we have:

- N = 2, because at each step, the remaining intervals are divided into two disjoint intervals.
- s = 3, because the length of the remaining intervals is one-third of the length of the previous intervals.

So, the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set is:

Hausdorff dimension = $\frac{\log 2}{\log 3} \approx 0.6309$
